section: This agreement shall begin upon the date of its execution by MA and acceptance in writing by Company and shall remain in effect until the end of the current calendar year and shall be automatically renewed for successive one (1) year periods unless otherwise terminated according to the cancellation or termination provisions contained in paragraph 18 of this Agreement.
explanation: The effective date is tied to execution and acceptance, but the term ends at the end of the calendar year, leading to a potentially very short initial term. This is inconsistent and ambiguous because it doesn't specify what happens if the agreement is executed very late in the calendar year.

section: MA shall pay to Company a quarterly service fee (the Service Fee) in the amount equal to US $15,000.00 on the first day of each quarter for the Term of this Agreement as set forth in Section 1 hereinabove, for each month that MA has no sales pursuant to this Schedule A, with the first payment due and payable on the date of execution of this Agreement.
explanation: This section states that the service fee is paid quarterly, however, also states that it is for each month that MA has no sales pursuant to this Schedule A. This is a contradiction, as it can be interpreted that it is to be paid quarterly and monthly.

section: Company reserves the right to change its process and/or fees, from time to time, in its sole and absolute discretion. In the event of a price and/or fee change for Technology, Company shall notify MA in writing ten (10) days prior to the effective date of any such change. All other prices and/or fees may be adjusted without prior notice to MA.
explanation: The clause indicates that company has sole and absolute discretion to change process and/or fees but then limits that discretion by stating a 10-day written notice is required for technology price changes, while other price/fees may be adjusted without notice. The text is inconsistent.
